sections.heading: I. READ  THE PASSAGE  AND ANSWER  THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS

questions.question: Where  is the Grand  Canyon  located?
questions.paragraph:
The Grand  Canyon  is one of the most famous  natural  wonders  in the world. 
It is located in the state of Arizona in the United States. The canyon was 
formed  by the Colorado River, which has been flowing through the area for 
millions  of years.  The river slowly  cut through  layers  of rock, creating  steep 
cliffs and colourful rock formations.  The Grand Canyon is about 446 kilometers long and over 1.6 kilometers deep. The rocks at the bottom of the canyon are some of the oldest on Earth. Many visitors come every year to hike, take photographs, or simply enjoy the breath taking views. The Grand Canyon is also home to many animals such as eagles, mountain lions, and snakes. It was declared a national park in 1919 to protect its natural beauty.

questions.question: When  was the Grand  Canyon  declared  a national  park?

sections.heading: II. READ THE FOLLOWING POEM AND ANSWER THE FOLLOWING QUESTIONS

questions.paragraph:
he Road Not Taken – by Robert Frost
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood 
 And sorry I could not travel both,
 And be one traveller, long I stood 
  And looked down one as far as I could
To where it bent in the undergrowth;
 Then took the other, as just as fair,
 And having perhaps the better claim
 Because it was grassy and wanted wear;
 Though as for that the passing there
 Had worn them really about the same.
questions.question: Where  is the speaker standing?
options: B) In a yellow  wood  where two  roads  meet
questions.answer: B) In a yellow  wood  where two  roads  meet

questions.paragraph:
he Road Not Taken – by Robert Frost

To where it bent in the undergrowth;
 Then took the other, as just as fair,
 And having perhaps the better claim
 Because it was grassy and wanted wear;
 Though as for that the passing there
 Had worn them really about the same.
questions.question: What do the two  roads  symbolize in  the poem?
options: B) Two life choices  or decisions
questions.answer: C) B) Two life choices  or decisions

questions.question: Why did the speaker choose the second road?
options: C) It seemed  less used and more interesting
D) It was easier to  walk on
questions.answer: C) It seemed  less used and more interesting

questions.question: What life  lesson  can we learn from the poem?
options: B) Choosing  your own  path can make  a difference
D) Roads  in forests  are dangerous
questions.answer: B) Choosing  your own  path can make  a difference
